name: microBUILD
description: Every couple of months we like to set aside an evening to keep working on our side projects. Join us for some pizza and hack-time.

name: Think: Reimagining the Spiritual Disciplines in a Digital Age
description: What does it look like to engage with spiritual disciplines in a world saturated by the technology we create?

name: Think: Discussion Evening
description: What is it that you want to talk about Christianity and technology? Perhaps it application for tech in your church, or the ethics of AI… bring your conversation starter and explore with us.

name: microBUILD
description: Today takes the passion of BUILD, and brings it for a day to Leeds. It isn't about being a rockstart dev it's about coming along, learning together, and working on a project that matters.

name: microBUILD
description: Every couple of months we like to set aside an evening to keep working on our side projects. Join us for some pizza and hack-time.

name: Drink
description: Join us for a quiet drink together, discussing intersection of Christianity & technology.

name: Think: Discussion Evening
description: Join us for our first discussion night exploring the intersection of Christianity and technology. We're going to be using a 'Lean Coffee' format, which gives everyone the chance to bring topics for discussion, and then be part of the conversation as much or as little as you want to.

name: Think: Church Through a Tech Lens
description: Christians are often portrayed as a bit backward with regard to technology, but is this really the case? On Monday 3rd Febuary we've invited church history lecturer Tom Breimaier to join us. We'll be exploring how technology is on display in history of the church, and how that challenges us to think of where we go, and what we build, from here.

name: microBUILD
description: Every couple of months we like to set aside an evening to keep working on our side projects. Join us for some pizza and hack-time.

name: Drink
description: We want to build relationships as well as projects. On Tuesday 12th we're going to gather together for a quiet drink together.

name: Drink
description: Join us on Monday 11th November, 7.30pm at The Crosse Keys for a quiet drink with people who love Jesus and are involved in shaping technology.

name: microBUILD
description: Every couple of months we like to set aside an evening to keep working on our side projects. Join us for some pizza and hack-time.

name: BUILD Hackathon
description: Kingdom Code BUILD is back for 2019! It is our annual hackathon bringing together Christians who work in the world of tech from across Europe.

name: Think: Design Sprint
description: September… it's a month until Kingdom Code BUILD, our annual hackathon, and we'll be beginning to think about what we're going to be building… We're inviting the mission agencies that we will be partnering with for BUILD to join us to share more about what they do and their hackathon challenges with us. We'll be condensing Google Venture's Design Sprint down to an hour and a bit to work through some techniques to come up with ideas, to refine those ideas, and then get them ready to be pitched at the hackathon.

name: Think: Design Sprint
description: September… it's a month until Kingdom Code BUILD, our annual hackathon, and we'll be beginning to think about what we're going to be building… We're inviting the mission agencies that we will be partnering with for BUILD to join us to share more about what they do and their hackathon challenges with us. We'll be condensing Google Venture's Design Sprint down to an hour and a bit to work through some techniques to come up with ideas, to refine those ideas, and then get them ready to be pitched at the hackathon.

name: microBUILD
description: Every couple of months we like to set aside an evening to keep working on our side projects. Join us for some pizza and some hack-time.

name: Think- Applying faith and tech locally
description: Earlier this year we looked at how our faith, God's heart and how these align with the current Sustainable Development Goals. This month we're focusing on what is happening locally in Bristol, hearing from Christians who are working out their faith in local projects, using tech to help alleviate food poverty and research being done on how to make organisations more sustainable.

name: The Fourth Industrial Revolution
description: The technological revolution we are currently experiencing will (and already is) radically changing Western society. Described as the 4th industrial revolution, modern technology affects all areas of our lives; from what we purchase, to how we date, to our energy consumption and employment opportunities. At the next Kingdom Code Think event Rev. Jimmy Lawrence will explore the nature of those changes, how we might think about them from a faith perspective, and crucially what we as technology producers can do about it.

name: BUILD shaping
description: Following on from the changes that we made to BUILD last year with the new venue and 24 hour format, we're going to be hosting an evening on Tuesday 9th July to explore how BUILD can be improved. If you'd like to be invovled with making the hackathon happen come along!

name: Think - Culture Making
description: Our enviroments are part of shaping our culture, the tools that we use are a key part of that too. The technology that we build, implement and use changes how we work together. This month Ben Drury is going to be leading us through an evening thinking about faith, tech and culture. One of the big questions he is facing into at the moment is how can Christians be part of creating and working in a culture where everyone excited and energised by what they do. No small task!

name: Think - Beginnings
description: Join us on Wednesday 8th May for a drink and to meet other Christians who work in the world of technology. James Doc of Kingdom Code London will join us to share the vision behind Kingdom Code as a national network. We'll think together about forming this community in Leeds and the issues which come up as we bring our faith and technology together.

name: microBUILD
description: We've set the evening aside to work together as a community on our different passion projects. Bring your idea, bring your project, or just come along to support someone elses project…

name: Drink
description: Join us on Monday 1st April, 7.30pm at The Crosse Keys for a quiet drink with people who love Jesus and are involved in shaping technology. The evening is super informal, no agenda, just come along and meet likeminded folk in the Kingdom Code community.

name: Think - From passion project to full time job…
description: How do you take a small hobby project from something like one of our BUILD events in to a proper full time project? This evening will include some input from Andy Geers on the story of how this happened for the PrayerMate app.

name: Think - Responding to the needs of our world
description: How are we called to respond to the needs of our world? What’s the role of tech in this and how can we contribute? Record numbers of displaced people, natural and man-made disasters are robbing people of life in all its fullness- including here in the South West. Join us as we explore how we can practically use our skill sets to bring love, life and hope into our cities.

name: Think - Generous Technologists
description: How does Christian generosity shape how we build tech? That was one of the questions that we were exploring last month during Kingdom Code BUILD. But we don't want to stop after the hackathon… we want to keep on exploring the topic together.

name: Think - With the Bible Society
description: This month we're going to be joined by Matt Cooper, Head of Digital at the Bible Society. They've existed since 1804 with the mission to bring the Bible to life; to help people around the world engage with it, relate to it, and make sense of it. No small task! Matt will be sharing more around how digital tools have changed how they work, and some of the plans for upcoming scripture engagement projects.

name: Think - Beginnings
description: Join us on Wednesday 18th April as we host the second event in the South West. Last month was an opportunity to begin to get to know other Christians in the tech world, tonight will be a time to start to think and discuss how our faith and technology come together.

name: Drink
description: Over the next three months we're going to be starting a set of events in the South West to build relationships between us, to encourage one another, to share about the things that we're working on, to start thinking about how our Christian worldview comes together with our vocation, and looking to put that into practice.
